createUserHelp:
You can do this manually, or sometimes via your ODBC driver under e.g. 'Services/Users/Add User'.

To do this manually:

1. Bring up your SQL console and connect to the EHR database (typically with your system username and password)

2. Run a SQL query similar to this (depending on your database type):

CREATE USER MEDIMAGE SET PASSWORD 'masterkey';

3. Click the 'Switch to MEDIMAGE user' button below.
createUserHelpFull:
You can do this manually, or via some ODBC drivers. After a successful connection using the system user, you will be given an option to switch to the MEDIMAGE user (which will give all correct permissions to that user).

To do this manually:

1. Bring up your database SQL console and connect to the EHR database (typically with the system user and password)

2. Run similar SQL queries to the following (this will vary depending on your database type):

CREATE USER MEDIMAGE SET PASSWORD 'masterkey';GRANT ALL ON ATTACHMENTSMGR TO MEDIMAGE;GRANT SELECT ON PATIENT TO MEDIMAGE;GRANT SELECT ON ANYBODY TO MEDIMAGE;

3. Set the username to 'MEDIMAGE' above.
odbcUserHelp:
Connecting with ODBC

1. Enter 'ODBC sources 32-bit' or 'ODBC sources 64-bit' in your Windows Start bar, choose your EHR's database driver, and create a new 'System DSN' (not a 'User DSN').

FieldExample Values
Data Source Name (DSN)medtech32
Databaselocalhost:1234
Database Accountsysadmin
Passwordyourpass

2. Fill out the details above, and click 'Test Connection', or the equivalent in your driver.

3. Enter the 'DSN' name i.e. 'medtech32' into the 'ODBC Database DSN name' field above. Click 'Save and Check Connection' below.
